means: 贪求，觊觎( covet的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: We begin by coveting what we see every day.
sentence.Network_cn: 垂涎的开始是我们每天看见的东西.

sentence.Network_en: We coveting what we see every day.
sentence.Network_cn: 之所以如此,是因为我们垂涎每日所见的一些东西.

sentence.Network_en: Agnes : By the way, I love your dress. I mean, I've been coveting it all day.
sentence.Network_cn: 顺便说一句, 我喜欢你的裙子, 我的意思是, 我一整天都对它垂涎.

list.abs: 英语的思维与中文的思维有何不同？_百度知道 ... 虎视眈眈： eye covetously 狼狈为奸： act in collusion with each other.
coversine 余矢covet of manhole 人孔盖covin 共谋;欺诈;密约
英语单词的奥秘 - luozhong10的日志 - 网易博客 ... avid（ 渴望的，贪婪的）； covet（ 垂涎，贪图）； visible（ 可见的，看得见的）…

entry.def: If you covet something, you strongly want to have it for yourself.

example.ex: She coveted his job so openly that conversations between them were tense.
example.tran: 她毫不隐讳地表示想得到他的工作，以至于他们之间说话都带着火药味。

auth_sentence.content: When I went custom, I also stopped coveting a new bike each season.
auth_sentence.res_content: When I went custom, I also stopped coveting a new bike each season.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: When I went custom, I also stopped coveting a new bike each season.

auth_sentence.content: Before long, I was coveting an upgrade to a lithium-ion battery, which is lighter and runs longer.
auth_sentence.res_content: Before long, I was coveting an upgrade to a lithium-ion battery, which is lighter and runs longer.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Before long, I was coveting an upgrade to a lithium-ion battery, which is lighter and runs longer.

auth_sentence.content: I remember coveting and eventually being permitted to own a book for the first time.
auth_sentence.res_content: I remember coveting and eventually being permitted to own a book for the first time.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I remember coveting and eventually being permitted to own a book for the first time.
